original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spill 2 bags of chips onto a cookie sheet and put in oven to heat them up. When oil is visible on the chips, take them out of the oven, and sprinkle with the garlic spice. Let them cool and serve.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the thinly sliced garlic between some parchment paper on a baking sheet. Bake until the garlic is dry, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool.
In a grinder add the dried garlic, salt, black peppercorns, mustard powder, and chili powder. Grind them all up.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Take approximately 1/2 of a bag of your favorite plain potato chips and spread them onto a cookie sheet.
Place the cookie sheet in the oven to heat them up until oil is visible on the chips.
Remove the chips from the oven and sprinkle with the prepared garlic spice.
Let the chips cool and then serve.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Take 1 garlic clove and slice it very thinly.
Place the thinly sliced garlic between some parchment paper on a baking sheet.
Bake the garlic until it is dry, about 15 minutes.
Remove the garlic from the oven and let it cool.
In a grinder, add the dried garlic, 0.25 teaspoon salt, 1 black peppercorn, 0.06 teaspoon mustard powder, and a pinch of chili powder.
Grind all the ingredients together to make the garlic spice.

recipe_title: Cucumber, Grape Tomato and Dill Salad
original_instructions: Put shallot, mustard, and vinegar in a blender, and blend. With the motor running, slowly drizzle in oil. Toss cucumber and dill in the vinaigrette with fennel seeds and chile. Fold in the tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 seedless, skinless, cucumber, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/4-inch half moons
1 bunch fresh dill, trimmed and minced
step_by_step_instructions: Finely mince about 0.12 of a large shallot.
Add the minced shallot, approximately 0.12 tablespoon of Dijon mustard, and 0.03 cup of balsamic vinegar to a blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
With the blender running, slowly drizzle in about 0.09 cup of olive oil until emulsified.
Take about 0.13 of a seedless, skinless cucumber, halve it lengthwise, and cut into 1/4-inch half moons.
Mix the cucumber slices with a small portion of minced dill, lightly toasted fennel seeds, and about 0.12 of a serrano chile, chopped.
Pour the vinaigrette over the cucumber mixture and toss to coat.
Fold in about 0.12 pint of grape tomatoes into the salad.

original_instructions:
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper to protect the baking sheet from spills and make for easy cleanup.
Peel the potatoes and slice them on a mandoline into 1/8-inch-thick slices. Or, using a chef's knife, carefully slice the potatoes thinly and evenly.
Arrange the potatoes in a medium casserole dish in overlapping layers, seasoning with salt and pepper as you go. Place the dish on the prepared baking sheet. Combine the milk, heavy cream, thyme, garlic and nutmeg in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat. Pour over the potatoes. Sprinkle the cheese over the top.
Bake until the potatoes are tender and the top is bubbling around the edges and a deep golden brown, about 1 hour. (If it starts to brown too deeply, cover the top of the dish with aluminum foil.) Let cool 10 minutes before serving.
ingredients: Coarse kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 cups 2-percent or whole milk, plus more if needed
1/2 cup heavy cream, plus more if needed
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper.
Peel about 10 ounces of russet potatoes and slice them into 1/8-inch-thick slices using a mandoline or chef's knife.
Arrange the potato slices in a medium casserole dish in overlapping layers, seasoning lightly with salt and pepper.
Place the casserole dish on the prepared baking sheet.
In a medium saucepan, combine 0.33 cup milk, 0.08 cup heavy cream, 0.17 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme, 0.17 clove garlic (finely chopped), and a small pinch of freshly grated nutmeg.
Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
Pour the simmered mixture over the layered potatoes.
Sprinkle 0.08 cup grated gruyere cheese over the top.
Bake in the oven until the potatoes are tender and the top is bubbling and golden brown, about 1 hour.
If the top starts to brown too deeply, cover with aluminum foil.
Let the dish cool for 10 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
In a food processor grate the potatoes. Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer potatoes to the sieve. Set sieve over a bowl, twist cheesecloth into a pouch, squeezing out some moisture. Let mixture drain for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, pour off liquid from the bowl but leave the white potato starch that settles in the bottom of the bowl.
To that starch add shallots, eggs, flour, 1-1/2 teaspoons of salt and freshly ground pepper. Return drained potatoes to this mixture and toss to combine.
Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Line a baking pan with paper towels. When you are ready to eat, in a large skillet heat 1/4 inch of oil over medium high heat until hot. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture and cook for 3 to 4 minutes a side; latkes should be golden and crisp on both sides. Eat right away or keep warm in oven.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons flour (or more) or matzo meal
1 1/2 teaspoons salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Peel and grate 1/3 pound of russet potatoes using a food processor.
Line a sieve with cheesecloth and transfer the grated potatoes to it.
Set the sieve over a bowl and twist the cheesecloth into a pouch to squeeze out some moisture.
Let the potato mixture drain for 15 minutes.
After draining, pour off the liquid from the bowl, leaving the white potato starch that settles at the bottom.
Add approximately 0.67 tablespoon of finely chopped shallots, 0.67 beaten large egg, 0.67 tablespoon of flour, 0.33 teaspoon of salt, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper to the starch.
Return the drained potatoes to the bowl and toss everything to combine.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit.
Line a baking pan with paper towels.
In a large skillet, heat 1/4 inch of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until hot.
Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of the potato mixture into the skillet.
Cook each latke for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until they are golden and crisp.
Eat the latkes right away or keep them warm in the preheated oven.

original_instructions:
Puree the tomatoes, celery and broth in a blender until smooth. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Season with lemon juice and maple syrup. Stir in cream.
Transfer to a microwave safe bowl. Heat in microwave on HIGH until warmed through, about 4 minutes. (Alternatively, heat the old-fashioned way in a pan.) Pour hot soup into an air-tight thermos. Pack in a lunch sack and send off to school.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Puree 14-ounce (half of the can) tomatoes, 0.5 rib celery, and 0.5 cup chicken broth in a blender until smooth.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice and 0.5 tablespoon maple syrup, stirring to combine.
Stir in 0.125 cup cream.
Transfer the mixture to a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat in the microwave on HIGH until warmed through, about 4 minutes.
Pour hot soup into an air-tight thermos for transport or serving.

recipe_title: Black Bean, Corn and Turkey Chili
original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the turkey, onion, chili powder, cumin, oregano, black pepper and garlic powder. Cook until the turkey is well browned, stirring often to separate meat.
Stir the stock, salsa, sugar, beans and corn in the saucepan and heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder or 2 cloves garlic, minced
1 can (about 15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (about 16 ounces) whole kernel corn, drained
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.

Add 0.25 pound ground turkey, 0.25 cup chopped onion, 0.5 tablespoon chili powder, 0.25 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.25 teaspoon dried oregano leaves, 0.125 teaspoon ground black pepper, and 0.0625 teaspoon garlic powder to the saucepan. Cook until the turkey is well browned, stirring often.
Stir in 0.4375 cup chicken stock, 0.25 cup chunky salsa, 0.25 tablespoon sugar, 4 ounces black beans, and 4.27 ounces corn.
Heat the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 30 minutes until hot and bubbling.

original_instructions:
In a food processor, puree the butter, tomatoes and garlic until it forms a smooth paste. Heat a small saute pan over medium heat and add the butter mixture. Heat the butter until melted down and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Keep warm.
Heat a large saucepan over high heat. Once hot, add the popcorn kernels and oil, and shake the pan to coat the kernels in the oil. Cover and continue to cook over high heat until the kernels begin to pop. Shake the pan once again and reduce the heat to medium-high. Continue to cook until the popping slows dramatically, 1 to 2 minutes.
Pour the popped popcorn into a large bowl. While still warm, add the flavored butter, cheese, oregano and salt. Toss to coat, and then serve.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained well
step_by_step_instructions: In a food processor, puree 1 tablespoon of butter, 0.06 cup of sun-dried tomatoes, and 0.25 clove of garlic until it forms a smooth paste.
Heat a small saute pan over medium heat and add the butter mixture.
Heat the butter until melted down and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Keep warm.
Heat a large saucepan over high heat.
Once hot, add 0.08 cup of popcorn kernels and 0.25 tablespoon of grapeseed oil, and shake the pan to coat the kernels in the oil.
Cover and continue to cook over high heat until the kernels begin to pop.
Shake the pan once again and reduce the heat to medium-high.
Continue to cook until the popping slows dramatically, 1 to 2 minutes.
Pour the popped popcorn into a large bowl.
While still warm, add the flavored butter, 0.5 tablespoon of Parmigiano-Reggiano, 0.19 teaspoon of oregano, and 0.13 teaspoon of kosher salt.
Toss to coat, and then serve.

original_instructions:
Remove the meat from the lobsters, chopping any large chunks into bite-size pieces. In a bowl, combine the lobster meat, mayonnaise, lemon juice, celery, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
Brush cut sides of the rolls with melted butter and fill with the lobster salad.
ingredients: 4 (1 1/2-pound) cooked lobsters or 4 lobster tails or 1 1/2 pounds lobster meat
2 inner celery stalks and leaves, finely chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Remove the meat from 1 cooked lobster, chopping any large chunks into bite-size pieces.

In a bowl, combine approximately 6 ounces of the lobster meat, 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1/2 stalk of celery (finely chopped), 1/2 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley leaves, and salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Brush the cut sides of one roll with melted butter.
Fill the roll with the lobster salad.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Mix the maple syrup and dark brown sugar in a small bowl.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set a rack on stop. Put the bacon on the rack leaving space between the strips. Brush with the maple syrup mixture and then sprinkle some fennel seeds on top¿fennel is a strong spice so use it sparingly. Season with black pepper.
Bake until brown and crisp, 20 to 25 minutes. Loosen the bacon from the rack and let it cool there 5 minutes before serving.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Mix 0.25 tablespoon pure maple syrup and 0.08 tablespoon dark brown sugar in a small bowl.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set a rack on top.
Put 1 slice of thick-cut bacon on the rack leaving space between the strips.
Brush with the maple syrup mixture and then sprinkle 0.17 teaspoons crushed fennel seeds on top.
Season with freshly ground black pepper.
Bake until brown and crisp, approximately 20 to 25 minutes.
Loosen the bacon from the rack and let it cool there for 5 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 425degrees.
Combine bread crumbs and 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese in large bowl. Dip pork in egg, then bread crumb mixture, coating well. Arrange pork on greased baking sheet. Bake, turning once, 18 minutes or until pork is done.
Meanwhile, heat Sauce in 2-quart saucepan. To serve, spoon sauce over hot penne. Top with pork, then sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons cheese.
ingredients: 3/4 lb. boneless pork or pork tenderloin, thinly sliced and pounded 1/4 inch thick
8 ounces penne pasta, cooked and drained
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Combine 1.5 tablespoons of bread crumbs and 0.5 tablespoon of Parmesan cheese in a large bowl.
Dip 0.25 lb. of pork in 0.25 beaten egg, then coat well with the bread crumb mixture.
Arrange the coated pork on a greased baking sheet.
Bake, turning once, for 18 minutes or until the pork is done.
Meanwhile, heat 0.33 cup of tomato and basil sauce in a 2-quart saucepan.
Serve by spooning the sauce over 3 ounces of hot penne pasta.
Top the pasta with the baked pork, then sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of remaining Parmesan cheese.

original_instructions: In a small bowl mash tuna with mayonnaise to taste to a smooth paste. Spread on bread and wrap securely in foil. Let sandwich sit 2 hours until mayonnaise has softened bread. Slice in half and serve with a glass of cold milk.;
ingredients: 1 small can solid white tuna packed in water, drained well
step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, mash 0.5 small can of tuna with 1.5 to 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise to a smooth paste.
Spread the mixture on 1 slice of bread.
Wrap the sandwich securely in foil.
Let the sandwich sit for 2 hours until the mayonnaise has softened the bread.
Slice the sandwich in half and serve with a glass of cold milk.

original_instructions: Take 1 tablespoon of the butter and add to a small fry pan, then saute the white parts of the scallions until soft. In a large sauce pot, boil the potatoes until they are tender. Drain the potatoes well, add the sauteed scallions, then mash and whip in butter, salt and white pepper, to taste, with a beater. Fold the cheese into the potatoes and allow it to melt. Stir to evenly distribute cheese, transfer to a serving dish and garnish with finely chopped tender green parts of scallions or fresh chives.
ingredients: 6 scallions, white parts only (use tender green parts for garnish below), finely sliced
6 large potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
Tender green parts from scallions above, finely chopped or 1/4 cup chopped fresh chives
step_by_step_instructions: Take 0.17 tablespoon of the butter and add to a small fry pan.
Saute the white parts of the scallions until soft.
In a large sauce pot, boil 1 potato chunk until it is tender.
Drain the potato well.
Add the sauteed scallions to the potato.
Mash and whip in approximately 1.33 tablespoons of butter, salt, and white pepper to taste, with a beater.
Fold in 0.33 cup of sharp shredded Cheddar into the potatoes and allow it to melt.
Stir to evenly distribute the cheese.
Transfer to a serving dish.
Garnish with finely chopped tender green parts of scallions.

original_instructions: Dip eggplant rounds in the flour, the egg and then in the bread crumbs and transfer to a sheet pan and arrange in a single layer. In a skillet heat 1/4-inch of olive oil and cook eggplant in batches, adding more olive oil to pan when necessary, until golden brown on both sides. Transfer cooked eggplant to paper towel-lined sheet pan to drain and season with salt and pepper. Spread warm marinara sauce in bottom of baking dish and alternate layers of eggplant, marinara sauce, basil, salt and pepper, grated Parmesan cheese and Mozzarella slices, ending with the Mozzarella on top. Bake in a pre-heated 350 F oven, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Slice the eggplant into 0.5-inch rounds.
Dip the eggplant rounds into 0.5 tbsp of flour.
Dip the eggplant into a quarter of an egg, beaten.
Coat the eggplant in 0.2 cups of bread crumbs.
Heat 0.1 cups of olive oil in a skillet.
Cook the eggplant in batches until golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes per batch.
Transfer cooked eggplant to a paper towel-lined sheet to drain.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Preheat the oven to 350 F.
Spread 0.5 cups of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer the eggplant, 0.5 cups of marinara sauce, 0.1 cup of basil, a pinch of salt and pepper, 0.1 cup of Parmesan cheese, and 2 oz of Mozzarella slices.
Repeat layering, ending with Mozzarella on top.
Bake uncovered in the oven for 30 minutes.

recipe_title: Cajun Rub for Deep Fried Turkey
original_instructions: Blend above and then rub over the entire turkey. This is enough for 1 (10 to 12) pound turkey.;
step_by_step_instructions: Blend the spices together thoroughly.
Rub the blended spices over the entire turkey, ensuring an even coating.

original_instructions: In a large saucepan heat oil and saute onions and garlic until onions are translucent. Add ginger, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, curry powder and saute for about 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes, squash, chicken or vegetable stock and deglaze pan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, covered for 20 minutes. Add 2 cups of the peas and simmer, covered, for another 10 minutes or until peas and squash are tender. Using an immersion blender puree soup in pot. Add remaining peas and reheat. Stir in cilantro. Adjust seasoning. Serve hot.
ingredients: Hot red pepper flakes to taste, crumbled
1/2 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, roughly chopped
3 cups fresh green peas (or 1 pound frozen)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.25 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large saucepan.
Saute 0.33 medium onion (chopped) and 0.33 garlic clove (minced) until the onion is translucent.
Add 0.17 teaspoon of grated fresh ginger, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes to taste, and 0.42 teaspoon of mild curry powder.
Saute the mixture for about 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add 0.67 plum tomato (chopped), 0.17 butternut squash (peeled, seeded, roughly chopped), and 1 cup of vegetable stock.
Deglaze the pan by stirring to release any browned bits.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes.
Add 0.67 cup of fresh green peas and simmer, covered, for another 10 minutes, or until the peas and squash are tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup in the pot.
Add the remaining 0.33 cup of peas and reheat the soup.
Stir in 0.03 cup of chopped cilantro.
Adjust seasoning to taste and serve hot.

original_instructions:
Cut lamb meat away from bone in 2 large pieces. Slice lengthwise into 1-inch strips and then cut into 1-inch cubes.
Combine ginger, garlic, soy sauce, onion, lemon juice and honey. Season with salt and pepper. Place meat in marinade and rest overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat broiler. Divide lamb among 6 skewers. Lay on a rack and broil 5 minutes each side.
Refill pineapple shell with pineapple flesh. To eat, stick end of each lamb skewer in a piece of pineapple.
ingredients: 1 (3 1/2 pound) leg of lamb, trimmed of heavy fat, shank removed
1 large ripe pineapple, cored, flesh cut into 1-inch pieces, with shell left whole and intact
step_by_step_instructions: Cut approximately 0.58 lbs of lamb meat away from the bone in two large pieces.
Slice lamb lengthwise into 1-inch strips and then cut into 1-inch cubes.
Combine 0.5 thin slices of ginger root, 0.67 cloves of garlic, 0.5 tbsp of soy sauce, 1.33 tbsp of finely sliced onion, juice from 0.08 lemons, and 0.5 tbsp of honey.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Place the lamb meat in the marinade and allow it to rest overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat the broiler.
Divide the marinated lamb among one skewer.
Lay the skewer on a rack and broil for 5 minutes on each side.
Refill the pineapple shell with approximately 2.67 oz of pineapple flesh.
To eat, stick the end of the lamb skewer in a piece of pineapple.

original_instructions:
Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F.
Line up strips of bacon on a sheet of waxed paper or parchment. Sprinkle half the sugar over top of bacon. Dust bacon with pepper to taste. With your fingers, rub in sugar and pepper. Turn bacon strips over and sprinkle the other side with remaining sugar and pepper to taste, rubbing it in.
Have a broiler pan with a slotted top or a rack set over a baking pan ready. Transfer the bacon strips to it, twisting each piece into a corkscrew as you place it. Place strips close together but do not touch. Bake until bacon is golden brown and crisp, turning with tongs about half way through, about 15 to 20 minutes.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F.
Line up approximately 2 strips of bacon on a sheet of waxed paper or parchment.
Sprinkle about 0.5 tablespoon of brown sugar over the bacon.
Dust the bacon with freshly ground black pepper to taste.
With your fingers, rub in the sugar and pepper.
Turn the bacon strips over and sprinkle the other side with another 0.5 tablespoon of brown sugar and pepper to taste, rubbing it in.
Prepare a broiler pan with a slotted top or a rack set over a baking pan.
Transfer the bacon strips to it, twisting each piece into a corkscrew shape as you place it.
Place the strips close together but do not let them touch.
Bake until the bacon is golden brown and crisp, turning with tongs about halfway through, approximately 15 to 20 minutes.
required_tools: broiler pan with slotted top or rack set over baking pan

original_instructions: Reserve the oysters refrigerated until ready to open. Make the sauce by stirring together the vinegar, soy sauce, mirin, and leek. Open the oysters and arrange on a platter. Spoon about half a teaspoon of the sauce onto each oyster, and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons minced leek, pale green portion only
step_by_step_instructions: Reserve 3 oysters refrigerated until ready to open.
Make the sauce by stirring together 0.38 tablespoon rice vinegar, 0.13 tablespoon soy sauce, 0.08 teaspoon mirin, and 0.25 teaspoon minced leek.
Open the oysters and arrange on a small platter.
Spoon about 0.5 teaspoon of the sauce onto each oyster, and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
For the hoagies:
Preheat frying pan over medium-high heat. Cut the hoagie rolls horizontally to open up and make a pocket. Add the blended oil to the pan and stir in the onions. Put the steak on top of onions and add 1/2-ounce of the butter. Cover the pan for 2 1/2 minutes. The meat should have a cooked appearance on top and rare underneath. Using a fork and spatula separate steak from the onions. When the meat is cooked add the salt, remaining butter, and provolone. Cover to the pan to melt the cheese. Divide the steak mixture among the hoagie rolls and serve. If you like, you can add the optional ingredients to the steak mixture before serving.
ingredients: 10 ounces sliced thin sweet onions in 1/16-inch slices
28 ounces sliced thin rib-eye steak in 1/16-inch slices
Optional ingredients: homemade tomato sauce, bell peppers, mushrooms, or your favorite cheese
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cut the hoagie roll horizontally to open up and make a pocket.
Add approximately 0.68 oz of the blended oil to the pan and stir in about 2.5 oz of sliced onions.
Put approximately 7 oz of sliced rib-eye steak on top of onions and add about 0.12 oz of butter.
Cover the pan for 2.5 minutes.
Using a fork and spatula, separate steak from the onions.
When the meat is cooked, add approximately 0.06 teaspoon of salt, about 0.38 oz of remaining butter, and a slice of provolone cheese.
Cover the pan to melt the cheese.
Divide the steak mixture into the hoagie roll and serve.

original_instructions:
Stir all ingredients in a small bowl to blend. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 month ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.
Stir all ingredients in a small bowl to blend. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 month ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.
step_by_step_instructions: Stir all ingredients in a small bowl to blend.
Store airtight at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly butter an 8 by 8-inch baking dish.
Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the sausage and cook until brown, about 5 minutes. Set the pan aside to cool.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper, to taste, until smooth, about 20 seconds. Add the red bell pepper, 1 cup of Gruyere cheese and 1/4 cup of parsley. Stir in the onion mixture. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cut the baked omelet into wedges and sprinkle with remaining parsley before serving.
Cook's Note: To make individual servings, divide the batter between 4 buttered 8-ounce ramekins. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes.
ingredients: 1/2 pound mild turkey sausage, casings removed
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Lightly butter an 8 by 8-inch baking dish.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 0.13 of a small onion, diced, and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add 0.06 lb of mild turkey sausage, casings removed, and cook until brown, about 5 minutes. Set the pan aside to cool.
In a large bowl, whisk together 1 large egg, 0.04 cup of whole milk, 0.13 teaspoon of kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper to taste until smooth, about 20 seconds.
Add 0.13 of a red bell pepper, diced, 0.19 cup of Gruyere cheese, and 0.03 cup of chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley.
Stir in the onion and sausage mixture.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Sprinkle with 0.06 cup of remaining Gruyere cheese.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cut the baked omelet into wedges and sprinkle with remaining parsley before serving.

original_instructions: Place broccolini in a large bowl. Add 1 cup water and tuck lemon peels in and around the broccolini. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave for 5 minutes. Remove from the microwave, drain and add a little salt.
step_by_step_instructions: Place approximately 0.38 pounds of broccolini in a large bowl.
Add about 0.25 cups of water to the bowl.
Tuck approximately 1 strip of lemon peel in and around the broccolini.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
Microwave the covered bowl for 5 minutes.
Remove the bowl from the microwave and drain the water.
Add a small pinch of salt to taste.

original_instructions:
Heat the butter in a 12-inch ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, onion and zucchini and cook until tender. Stir in the egg mixture. Reduce the heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes or until the eggs are set but still moist.
Heat the broiler. Sprinkle the cheese over the egg mixture. Broil the frittata with the top 4 inches from the heat for 2 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle with the green onion.
Serving Suggestion: Serve with whole-grain rolls and a fresh fruit salad. For dessert serve lemon sorbet and meringue cookies.
ingredients: 1 can (10 3/4 ounces) Campbell's Condensed Broccoli Cheese Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.50 tbsp of butter in a 12-inch ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.33 cup of sliced mushrooms, 0.17 cup of chopped onion, and 0.17 cup of sliced zucchini; cook until tender.
In a bowl, mix 1 egg, 0.18 can of broccoli cheese soup, 1.5 tbsp of milk, and 0.02 tsp of ground black pepper.
Stir the egg mixture into the skillet and reduce heat to low.
Cook for 5 minutes or until the eggs are set but still moist.
Heat the broiler.
Sprinkle 1 tbsp of shredded Cheddar cheese over the egg mixture.
Broil the frittata with the top 4 inches from the heat for 2 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Sprinkle with 0.33 tbsp of chopped green onion.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Whisk together the oil, vinegar, garlic paste and thyme in a medium bowl, add the tomatoes and toss to coat. Let tomatoes sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to marinate.
Heat the grill to high.
Remove the tomatoes from the marinade and skewer 4 per skewer, depending on the size of the tomatoes). Season on both sides with salt and pepper and grill until golden brown and slightly charred on both sides, about 6 minutes. Transfer the skewers to a platter and garnish with chives.
ingredients: 3 cloves garlic, finely chopped and made into garlic paste
1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves
8 to 10 wooden (6-inch) skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil, 0.38 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar, 0.5 clove of garlic (made into paste), and 0.13 tablespoon of chopped fresh thyme in a medium bowl.
Add 3 cherry tomatoes to the bowl and toss to coat them in the marinade.
Let the tomatoes sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to marinate.
Meanwhile, soak 1 wooden skewer in water for 30 minutes.
Heat the grill to high.
Remove the tomatoes from the marinade and skewer them.
Season both sides of the tomatoes with salt and pepper.
Grill the skewered tomatoes until golden brown and slightly charred on both sides, about 6 minutes.
Transfer the skewers to a platter and garnish with a pinch of finely chopped fresh chives.

recipe_title: Saute of Chicken Breasts with Coconut Milk and Herbs
original_instructions:
Between sheets of plastic wrap pound the thicker side of the breast to make it overall more even in thickness and season lightly with salt.
Heat the sesame oil in a skillet over moderate heat. Add the chicken breasts and tenderloins. Saute the chicken without disturbing the pieces for 4 to 5 minutes. You'll know to turn the chicken over when the top looks opaque (tenderloins may take only 2 to 3 minutes per side). Turn the chicken over to the other side and saute, undisturbed again for another 4 to 5 minutes or until the interior is cooked through.
Remove the chicken to a plate and discard the fat from the skillet. Squeeze the juice from the lime into the skillet and scrape up any coagulated juices into the juice; add the coconut milk, bring it to a simmer. Remove the skillet from the heat and whisk in the scallions and cilantro; season to taste with salt and dried red pepper flakes.
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, tenderloins separated
Half a lime or lemon, seeds removed
1 small scallion (green onion), trimmed and finely sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Between sheets of plastic wrap, pound the thicker side of half a chicken breast and a tenderloin to make it overall more even in thickness and season lightly with salt.
Heat 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in a skillet over moderate heat.
Add the chicken breast and tenderloin to the skillet.
Saute the chicken without disturbing the pieces for 2 to 3 minutes on one side. Turn the chicken over when the top looks opaque.
Saute on the other side for another 2 to 3 minutes or until the interior is cooked through.
Remove the chicken to a plate and discard the fat from the skillet.
Squeeze the juice from a quarter of a lime into the skillet and scrape up any coagulated juices into the juice.
Add 2 tablespoons of coconut milk to the skillet and bring it to a simmer.
Remove the skillet from the heat and whisk in 1 teaspoon of sliced scallions and 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro.
Season to taste with salt and dried red pepper flakes.

recipe_title: Aromatic Noodles With Lime Peanut Sauce
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Cook the pasta in a large pot of water according to the directions on the package. Drain and rinse with cold water. While the pasta is cooking put the broccoli in a steamer basket over a large pot of boiling water and steam it for 3 minutes. Add the snow peas and sugar snap peas and steam for 2 minutes more.
Toast the peanuts in a dry pan over a medium heat until they become fragrant, about 3 minutes. Set them aside to cool. Make the sauce by pureeing the peanut butter, soy sauce, water, vinegar, lime juice, scallion, ginger, sugar and red pepper flakes in a food processor or blender until smooth.
Right before serving, toss the pasta with 3/4 cup of the peanut sauce. Divide into 6 serving bowls and top each serving with the vegetables. Drizzle the remaining sauce over the vegetables. Coarsely chop the peanuts, sprinkle them on top and serve.
ingredients: 3/4 pound spinach linguine or whole-wheat spaghetti
2 cups (about 6 ounces) sugar snap peas, trimmed
step_by_step_instructions: Cook about 57 grams (2 ounces) of pasta in a large pot of water according to the package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Place about 30 grams (1 ounce) of broccoli in a steamer basket over a pot of boiling water and steam for 3 minutes.
Add about 20 grams (0.7 ounces) of snow peas and 20 grams (0.7 ounces) of sugar snap peas to the steamer and steam for an additional 2 minutes.
Toast about 14 grams (0.5 ounces) of shelled peanuts in a dry pan over medium heat for about 3 minutes until fragrant. Set aside to cool.

Make the sauce by pureeing approximately 18 grams (0.63 ounces) of peanut butter, 10 ml (0.34 ounces) of soy sauce, 10 ml (0.34 ounces) of water, 5 ml (0.17 ounces) of rice vinegar, 5 ml (0.17 ounces) of lime juice, a small piece of scallion, a small amount of grated ginger, 5 grams (0.17 ounces) of brown sugar, and a pinch of red pepper flakes in a food processor or blender until smooth.
Right before serving, toss the pasta with about 29 ml (1 ounce) of the peanut sauce.
Divide the pasta into a bowl and top with the steamed vegetables.
Drizzle the remaining sauce over the vegetables.
Coarsely chop the toasted peanuts, sprinkle them on top, and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 2-quart baking dish.
Heat the butter in a medium skillet set over medium heat. Add the leek and cook, stirring occasionally until soft, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the apples and cook until slightly soft, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the cornbread, parsley and sage to the leek mixture. Gradually add the broth, stirring gently until the cornbread is well moistened but not soggy. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread out in the prepared baking dish and bake until heated through and lightly browned, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.
Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for buttering the dish
1 large leek, white part with 1-inch of green, finely chopped and rinsed
2 small apples, peeled, cored and chopped
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, plus more for topping
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Butter a small portion of a 2-quart baking dish, estimated to be about 1/4 of the surface area.
Heat approximately 0.5 tablespoons of butter in a medium skillet over medium heat.
Add about 0.25 of a large leek, finely chopped and rinsed, to the skillet.
Cook the leek, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Add about 0.5 small apple, peeled, cored, and chopped, to the skillet.
Cook the apple until slightly soft, about 5 minutes.
Remove the skillet from the heat and transfer the contents to a large bowl.
Add approximately 1 cup of cubed day-old cornbread to the bowl.
Add about 0.5 tablespoons of finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley and 0.25 tablespoons of finely chopped fresh sage to the bowl.
Gradually add about 0.25 to 0.33 cups of low-sodium chicken broth, stirring gently until the cornbread is well moistened but not soggy.
Season the mixture with a pinch of kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Spread the mixture out in the prepared section of the baking dish.
Bake in the oven until heated through and lightly browned, approximately 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with a small amount of finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley before serving.

original_instructions: Boil potatoes. Drain water. In a bowl, add the potatoes and garlic cloves and mash. Keep potatoes a little chunky to add texture. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the vegetable oil on medium heat in a frying pan. Cook the shallots until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the shallots to the smashed potatoes. Add the smashed potatoes to a pan, sprinkle with salt and pepper and fry. Using a spatula flip the potatoes constantly to allow them to crisp up and turn golden brown, about 5 minutes.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Boil approximately 1 potato until tender.
Drain the water from the pot.
In a bowl, add the boiled potato and 1 to 2 cloves of garlic, then mash together while keeping the potatoes a bit chunky.
Season the mashed mixture with salt and pepper.
Heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil on medium heat in a frying pan.
Cook 1 shallot, thinly sliced, in the pan until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the cooked shallots to the bowl with the mashed potatoes.
Add the mashed potato mixture back to the frying pan, sprinkle with more salt and pepper if desired, and fry.
Using a spatula, flip the potatoes constantly to allow them to crisp up and turn golden brown, about 5 minutes.

original_instructions:
Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 475°F. Mix first 3 ingredients in medium bowl. Mix in feta, 1/2 cup Parmesan, Jack cheese, and onions. Spread 2 tablespoons cheese mixture onto each bread slice. Top each with 1 tablespoon Parmesan; press to adhere. Place on baking sheet. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Bake until cheese is golden and bubbly, about 12 minutes.
Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 475°F. Mix first 3 ingredients in medium bowl. Mix in feta, 1/2 cup Parmesan, Jack cheese, and onions. Spread 2 tablespoons cheese mixture onto each bread slice. Top each with 1 tablespoon Parmesan; press to adhere. Place on baking sheet. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Bake until cheese is golden and bubbly, about 12 minutes.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups (about) grated Parmesan cheese, divided (about 4 ounces)
12 3/4-inch-thick slices pain rustique or ciabatta bread
step_by_step_instructions: Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 475°F.
Mix 0.17 tablespoon mayonnaise, 0.17 tablespoon butter, and 0.08 clove garlic in a medium bowl.
Mix in 0.11 cup feta, 0.10 cup Parmesan, 0.08 cup Monterey Jack cheese, and 0.04 cup green onions.
Spread 0.17 tablespoon cheese mixture onto 1 slice of bread.
Top with 0.08 tablespoon Parmesan; press to adhere.
Place on baking sheet and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
Bake until cheese is golden and bubbly, about 12 minutes.

original_instructions:
Pat the peppers dry with a paper towel and set aside.
Wrap each cheese stick with a slice of ham, then slice the wrapped sticks into approximately 1/2-inch cubes. Stuff the wrapped cheese cubes into the peppers.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy-bottomed pot to 350 degrees F.
Set up a breading station using pie pans or plates. Put the flour in the first pie pan, then whisk together the egg and 2 tablespoons water in the second pie pan. In the third, mix together the panko, salt and pepper. Run each stuffed pepper through the breading station: lightly coat in the flour, dip in the egg wash and thoroughly coat in the panko.
Fry the peppers in batches in the hot oil until the breading is lightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate lined with a paper towel. Serve hot.
ingredients: 16 jarred sweet piquante peppers, such as Peppadew
About 3 cups canola oil, for frying
step_by_step_instructions: Pat 4 sweet piquante peppers dry with a paper towel and set aside.
Wrap half a Cheddar cheese stick with half a slice of deli ham, then slice the wrapped stick into approximately 1/2-inch cubes.
Stuff the wrapped cheese cubes into the 4 peppers.
Heat about 3/4 cup canola oil in a medium heavy-bottomed pot to 350 degrees F.
Set up a breading station using pie pans or plates.
Put 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour in the first pie pan.
Whisk together 1/4 of a large egg and 1/2 tablespoon of water in the second pie pan.
Mix 1/4 cup of panko breadcrumbs, 1/8 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper in the third pie pan.
Run each stuffed pepper through the breading station: lightly coat in the flour, dip in the egg wash and thoroughly coat in the panko.
Fry the peppers in the hot oil until the breading is lightly browned, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Transfer to a plate lined with a paper towel and serve hot.

original_instructions:
Put the flour in a shallow bowl or lipped plate. Break the eggs into another shallow bowl and whisk with the salt and pepper. In a third shallow bowl mix the breadcrumbs with herbs.
Bread the chops. Dredge a chop in the flour, shaking off the excess, then dip it into the eggs, and finally coat the meat evenly with the breadcrumbs. Set on a piece of waxed paper or baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining chops. Heat a large skillet over medium heat with enough oil to come halfway up the sides of the chops, about 1/4 cup. When the oil shimmers, add the chops and fry 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately with lemon wedges.
ingredients: Four 1/2-inch-thick, bone-in, pork chops (about 1-1/2 pounds), patted dry
Extra-virgin olive oil for shallow frying
step_by_step_instructions: Put approximately 1 tablespoon of flour in a shallow bowl or lipped plate.
Break half an egg into another shallow bowl and whisk with a pinch of salt and pepper.
In a third shallow bowl, mix about 0.38 cup of breadcrumbs with a pinch of dried thyme, marjoram, and basil.
Dredge one pork chop in the flour, shaking off the excess.
Dip the chop into the egg mixture.
Coat the chop evenly with the breadcrumb mixture.
Set the breaded chop on a piece of waxed paper or baking sheet.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat with about 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
When the oil shimmers, add the chop and fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with a lemon wedge.

recipe_title: Roasted Peppers Stuffed with Cherry Tomatoes, Onion, and Basil
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Lightly oil a large shallow baking pan with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Arrange peppers, cut sides up, in baking pan, and lightly oil the cut edges and stems.
In a bowl, toss the tomatoes, onion, basil, garlic, 2 tablespoons oil, red pepper flakes, mozzarella, and salt and pepper, to taste.
Divide mixture among peppers and roast in upper third of oven until peppers are tender, about 20 minutes.
ingredients: 4 red bell peppers, halved through the stem, seeds and ribs removed but stem intact
1 cup packed fresh basil leaves, chiffonaded
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Lightly oil a large shallow baking pan with 0.25 tablespoon olive oil.
Arrange 1 red bell pepper half, cut side up, in the baking pan, and lightly oil the cut edges and stem.

In a bowl, toss 0.25 pint cherry tomatoes, 0.25 medium onion, 0.25 cup packed fresh basil leaves, 0.75 garlic cloves, 0.06 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 0.25 cup cubed mozzarella, and salt and pepper to taste with 0.5 tablespoon olive oil.
Fill the pepper half with the mixture.
Roast in the upper third of the oven until the pepper is tender, about 20 minutes.

recipe_title: Roasted Rainbow Trout with Rock Shrimp and Sage Butter Stuffing
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Well in advance of cooking the fish, prepare the stuffing. Combine the sage, softened butter, lemon juice, spice and seasonings, bread crumbs, pine nuts, jalapenos, garlic and coriander in the bowl of a food processor, pulsing to combine well. Remove and place in a bowl. Keep refrigerated until ready to use.
Season the trout with salt and pepper and rub the trout with olive oil.
Divide the stuffing between the 4 fish evenly and spread an even layer inside the cavity of the fish. Divide the shrimp in the same way and add the shrimp in a layer in top of the herb butter. Close the fish to seal in the stuffing.
Lay the fish on an oiled rack and set in a roasting pan.
Place the fish in the oven and roast for 12 minutes on each side. Remove and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened to room temperature
2 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
4 butterflied rainbow trout, whole, skin on, bones removed (ask your fish dealer to do this for you)
1/2 pound cleaned and shelled rock shrimp
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.

Prepare the stuffing by combining 0.75 tablespoons chopped fresh sage, 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, 0.25 tablespoon lemon juice, 0.13 teaspoon salt, 0.13 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 0.13 teaspoon paprika, 0.75 chopped scallion, 2 tablespoons dry bread crumbs, 1 tablespoon pine nuts, 0.5 diced jalapeno pepper, 0.25 clove finely chopped garlic, and 0.25 tablespoon toasted, ground coriander seed in a food processor. Pulse to combine well.
Remove the stuffing from the processor, place in a bowl, and refrigerate until ready to use.
Season 1 rainbow trout with salt and pepper and rub with olive oil.
Divide the stuffing into 1 portion and spread an even layer inside the cavity of the trout.
Add 2 ounces of rock shrimp in a layer on top of the stuffing.
Close the trout to seal in the stuffing.
Lay the trout on an oiled rack and set in a roasting pan.
Place the trout in the oven and roast for 12 minutes on one side.
Flip the trout and roast for another 12 minutes on the other side.
Remove the trout from the oven and serve immediately.

recipe_title: Artichoke and Bean Salad with Tuna
original_instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss gently and refrigerate 45 minutes before serving.
Serve salad on a bed of mixed greens with crusty bread. Or alternatively, serve salad scooped onto a hero roll with arugula.
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can white northern or cannellini beans, drained & rinsed
1 (15-ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and quartered
Kosher salt and cracked black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 3.75 ounces of white northern or cannellini beans, 3.75 ounces of artichoke hearts, 0.25 rib of celery, 0.5 tablespoon of red onion, 1.5 ounces of tuna, 0.75 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil, juice and zest of 0.25 lemon, and 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley in a mixing bowl.
Season to taste with kosher salt and cracked black pepper.
Toss gently and refrigerate for 45 minutes before serving.
Serve the salad on a bed of mixed greens with crusty bread, or alternatively, scoop the salad onto a hero roll with arugula.

recipe_title: Grilled Endive and Radicchio with Gorgonzola and Sage-Infused Olive Oil
original_instructions:
Preheat the grill to high heat.
Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan until hot. Add the sage and allow the sage to infuse its flavor into the oil. Remove from the heat when the sage becomes fragrant and slightly crispy, a few minutes.
Grill the endive and radicchio until slightly wilted with good grill marks, about 4 minutes per side. Turn the endive and radicchio cut-side up and top with the gorgonzola. Close the lid and grill until the cheese has softened, 2 minutes.
Remove the endive and radicchio to a platter. Drizzle the infused olive oil over the top. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 heads endive, sliced in half lengthwise
3 heads radicchio di Treviso, sliced in half lengthwise
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the grill to high heat.
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a small saucepan until hot.
Add 1 sprig of sage to the hot oil and allow it to infuse its flavor into the oil.
Remove from heat when the sage becomes fragrant and slightly crispy, a few minutes.
Grill 0.5 head of endive and 0.5 head of radicchio until slightly wilted with good grill marks, about 4 minutes per side.
Turn the endive and radicchio cut-side up and top with 1 ounce of crumbled gorgonzola.
Close the lid and grill until the cheese has softened, 2 minutes.
Remove the endive and radicchio to a platter.
Drizzle the infused olive oil over the top.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Spread the butter on both sides of the bread.
Build the sandwich with the ham and cheeses and place in the hot skillet. Cook until the bread is golden and toasty, a few minutes on each side.
Arrange the tomato halves for the eyes, 1/4 cheese slice for a nose and pickle spear for a smile.
This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition. The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use, therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.
ingredients: 2 slices American cheese, plus 1/4 slice for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Spread about 1 tablespoon of butter on both sides of each slice of bread.
Build the sandwich with 1 slice of ham, 1 slice of American cheese, and 1 slice of mozzarella cheese.
Place the sandwich in the hot skillet.
Cook until the bread is golden and toasty, about 3 minutes on each side.
Remove the sandwich from the skillet.
Arrange half of a grape tomato for each eye, a small strip of the remaining 1/4 slice of cheese for the nose, and the pickle spear for the smile.

original_instructions:
Pour buttermilk into a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix flour, salt, and garlic powder. Dip each fish portion into buttermilk then roll in flour until evenly covered, set aside on plate.
Heat deep-fat fryer to 360 degrees F and cook fish for 6-8 minutes, or until golden brown and done. To check for doneness, cut into one portion and check to see if fish is flaky and looks milky white. Serve with french fries, coleslaw, and garlic bread.
ingredients: 2 pounds cod or halibut, cut into 2 ounce portions
Serving suggestions: french fries, coleslaw, and garlic bread
step_by_step_instructions: Pour 0.25 cups buttermilk into a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix 0.13 cups flour, 0.06 teaspoons seasoned salt, and 0.13 teaspoons garlic powder.
Dip one 2-ounce portion of fish into the buttermilk, then roll in the flour mixture until evenly covered, and set aside on a plate.
Heat a deep-fat fryer to 360 degrees F.
Cook the fish for 6-8 minutes, or until golden brown and done.
To check for doneness, cut into the fish portion and check to see if it is flaky and looks milky white.
Serve the fish with a side of french fries, coleslaw, and garlic bread.

original_instructions: To a wok or saucepan over a low flame, add oil. Oil should be cold. Add garlic. Fry garlic for about 4 to 5 minutes. Remove when garlic chips are brown and place towels to drain. Add spinach, and pepper flakes. Saute for 3 to 4 minutes. Garnish with garlic chips.;
step_by_step_instructions: To a wok or saucepan over a low flame, add 1 tablespoon of cold olive oil.
Add 1 clove of sliced garlic to the cold oil.
Fry the garlic for about 4 to 5 minutes until the garlic chips are brown.
Remove the garlic chips and place them on towels to drain.
Add about 1 bunch of spinach and a pinch of hot pepper flakes to the pan.
Saute the spinach for 3 to 4 minutes.
Garnish with the garlic chips.

recipe_title: Insalata di Fagioli e Tonno: Tuna and Bean Salad
original_instructions: Mix cannellini beans, tuna, and celery in a salad bowl. Squeeze the lemon juice into the bowl. Pour in the extra-virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Mix well.
ingredients: 2 (19-ounce) cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
14 ounces canned tuna in oil or water, drained
step_by_step_instructions: In a salad bowl, mix approximately 7.60 ounces of cannellini beans, 5.60 ounces of drained tuna, and 0.25 cup of chopped celery.
Squeeze the juice from 1/4 of a lemon into the bowl.
Pour in 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Mix the ingredients well to combine.

original_instructions:
In a small saucepan over high heat, bring the rice and 1 1/2 cups water to a boil. Reduce the heat; cover and simmer 5 minutes, or until all of the water is absorbed. Stir in the vinegar, sugar, all-purpose seasoning and salt.
On a cutting board, separate the salmon slices and cut into 1 1/2-inch-wide strips. Place 2 teaspoons of the rice at one end of each salmon strip and roll up tightly. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired. Serve the sushi bites with the soy sauce for dipping.
Photograph by Kana Okada
step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan over high heat, bring 0.25 cups of instant rice and 0.25 cups of water to a boil.
Reduce the heat; cover and simmer for 5 minutes, or until all of the water is absorbed.
Stir in 0.25 teaspoons rice vinegar, 0.17 teaspoons sugar, 0.12 teaspoons salt-free all-purpose seasoning, and a small pinch of salt.
On a cutting board, separate approximately 1 ounce of salmon slices and cut into 1.5-inch-wide strips.
Place 2 teaspoons of the rice at one end of each salmon strip and roll up tightly.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired.
Serve the sushi bites with soy sauce for dipping.

original_instructions:
Make batter: In a blender blend batter ingredients until smooth and transfer to a bowl. Let batter stand, covered, 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spoon 1 teaspoon roast drippings into each cup of 3 mini muffin pans. Put 2 mini-muffin pans on 1 baking sheet and put remaining pan on another baking sheet. Put first baking sheet with the two mini muffin pans in middle of oven for 3 minutes to heat drippings in cups. Working quickly, pour 2 teaspoons of batter into hot drippings in each cup and bake in middle of oven 18 minutes, or until pudding shells are golden and puffed. Remove shells from cups with tongs and cool on racks. Repeat procedure with other baking sheet. Shells may be made 3 days ahead and chilled, covered, or 1 month ahead and frozen in airtight containers. Bring shells to room temperature and re-crisp in a 300 degree oven 10 minutes.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
3/4 cup roast drippings or vegetable oil
Garnish: 36 small fresh flat-leafed parsley leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Blend all batter ingredients until smooth and pour into a bowl. Cover and let stand for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spoon 1 teaspoon of roast drippings into a cup of a mini muffin pan.
Place the mini muffin pan in the oven to heat the drippings for 3 minutes.
Quickly pour approximately 1.5 teaspoons of batter into the hot drippings.
Bake for 18 minutes until the pudding is golden and puffed.
Remove pudding from the muffin pan, using tongs, and cool on a rack.

original_instructions:
In a large cast iron pot, or heavy-bottomed braising pan add the bacon and fry until crisp. Remove from the pan and drain on a paper towel.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Cut the bread lengthwise and put in the oven.
Add the pork to the bacon grease, and cook on medium-high heat until the pork is 3/4 cooked. Next add the sausages, onions, and bell peppers and cook until the onions are translucent.
Add the chicken, celery, garlic, parsley, and 3/4 cup green onions. Cook until chicken is tender, then season with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Stir in the water and combine thoroughly. Cover and let sit for 15 minutes.
Evenly divide the meat mixture and cheese to each loaf. Top the cheese with the bacon and remaining green onions. Cut the loaves in half and serve.
ingredients: 1 pound pork butt or pork loin, cut in 1/2-inch pieces
1 pound boneless chicken thighs, cut in 1/2-inch pieces
2 teaspoons cayenne pepper, or to taste
step_by_step_instructions: In a large cast iron pot or heavy-bottomed braising pan, add 0.03 lb diced bacon and fry until crisp. Remove from the pan and drain on a paper towel.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.
Cut a 6-inch length of sourdough bread and put it in the oven.
Add 0.13 lb pork to the bacon grease, and cook on medium-high heat until the pork is 3/4 cooked.
Add 0.13 lb smoked sausage, 0.06 lb andouille sausage, 0.25 cup chopped red onions, and 0.13 cup julienned red bell peppers. Cook until the onions are translucent.
Add 0.13 lb boneless chicken thighs, 0.5 stalk thinly sliced celery, 0.13 tbsp minced fresh garlic, 0.03 cup chopped parsley leaves, and 0.13 cup chopped green onions. Cook until chicken is tender.
Season with 0.13 tsp salt, 0.25 tsp freshly cracked black pepper, and 0.25 tsp cayenne pepper. Stir in 0.06 cup water and combine thoroughly. Cover and let sit for 15 minutes.
Evenly divide the meat mixture and 0.13 lb Havarti cheese onto the bread.
Top the cheese with the bacon and 0.03 cup remaining green onions.
Cut the bread in half and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Scrub potatoes under cold running water; leave skins on. Slice potatoes into thick rounds and then brush both sides of potatoes liberally with olive oil. Place potatoes on grill and grill on both sides until slightly brown, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and place in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Drizzle potatoes liberally with olive oil again on both sides and then season both sides with salt and pepper. Place baking sheet on the grates of the grill and cook for about 10 more minutes, or until cooked through in the center and crispy on the outside. Remove from grill and sprinkle with minced garlic and chopped thyme leaves. Serve.
ingredients: 4 to 6 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Scrub 1 Yukon gold potato under cold running water; leave the skin on.
Slice the potato into thick rounds.
Brush both sides of the potato rounds liberally with olive oil.
Place the potato rounds on the grill and grill on both sides until slightly brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Remove from the grill and place in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Drizzle the potato rounds liberally with olive oil again on both sides.
Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Place the baking sheet on the grates of the grill and cook for about 10 more minutes, or until cooked through in the center and crispy on the outside.
Remove from the grill and sprinkle with minced garlic and chopped thyme leaves.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Spray 8 muffin tins with vegetable spray. Layer potato slices, cheese, and onions into each muffin cup. Season with salt and pepper and top each gratin with 1 or 2 tablespoons of heavy cream. Cover with foil and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, removing the foil halfway through cooking time. Invert gratins onto plate and serve.
ingredients: 2 large russet potatoes, roughly peeled and thinly sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Spray 1 muffin tin with vegetable spray.
Layer approximately 2.5 oz of potato slices into the muffin cup.
Add about 1 tbsp of grated Swiss cheese on top of the potatoes.
Sprinkle with a small pinch of finely chopped green onions.
Season with a pinch of salt and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper.
Top the gratin with about 1 tbsp of heavy cream.
Cover the muffin tin with foil and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, removing the foil halfway through cooking.
Invert the gratin onto a plate and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat grill.
Whisk olive oil, vinegar, dill, salt and pepper together in a small bowl; set aside.
Assemble skewers, starting with garlic, mushroom, zucchini, onion, and tomato. Repeat until skewer is full, leaving 1 inch at each end of skewer. Brush each skewer with olive oil marinade. Grill for about 6 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked to your liking, turning skewers once after 3 minutes.
ingredients: 1/2 cup red onion, cut into 1-inch dice
4 wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes, or 4 metal skewers
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat grill.
Whisk 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar, 0.25 teaspoon of fresh dill, 0.125 teaspoon of salt, and a pinch of cracked black pepper together in a small bowl; set aside.

Assemble skewer, starting with 1 large clove of garlic, 2 button mushrooms, 0.5 large zucchini, 2 tablespoons of red onion, and 1 plum tomato. Repeat until skewer is full, leaving 1 inch at each end of skewer.
Brush each skewer with olive oil marinade.
Grill for about 6 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked to your liking, turning skewer once after 3 minutes.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Using a mandoline slicer or very sharp knife, slice the mushrooms as thinly as possible and arrange them in a single layer on a large serving platter. Scatter the arugula evenly over the top.
Just before serving, squeeze the juice of the lemon over the arugula and very lightly drizzle with some olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and using a vegetable peeler, shave thin strips of Parmesan evenly over the top. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1/2 pound large white mushrooms, brushed clean and trimmed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Using a mandoline slicer or very sharp knife, slice about 2.67 ounces of mushrooms as thinly as possible and arrange them in a single layer on a large serving platter.
Scatter approximately 1.33 ounces of arugula evenly over the top of the mushrooms.
Just before serving, squeeze the juice from 0.5 of a lemon over the arugula.
Very lightly drizzle about 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil over the arugula and mushrooms.
Season with a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper.
Using a vegetable peeler, shave thin strips from about 0.67 ounces of Parmesan and distribute evenly over the top.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Salsiccie e Fagioli: Pork and Beans
original_instructions:
In a saucepan, heat the olive oil. Saute the garlic and add the sausages and rosemary. Cook for a few minutes, turning the sausages over. Pierce the sausages to allow the fat to drip out and flavor up the dish. Add the tomatoes to the pan. With the back of a wooden spoon, break up the tomatoes into little chunks. Add 1/2 a cup of water and allow to simmer. Then add the beans, salt, and pepper.
Let cook together for about 15 minutes or until the sauce has reduced and thickened.
ingredients: 2 (19-ounce/540 ml) cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil in a saucepan.
Sauté 0.5 clove of garlic, then add 1 sausage link and a small piece of rosemary.
Cook for a few minutes, turning the sausage over.
Pierce the sausage to allow the fat to drip out.
Add 35.38 g of peeled plum tomatoes to the pan.
Break up the tomatoes into little chunks with the back of a wooden spoon.
Add 2 tablespoons of water and allow to simmer.
Add approximately 135 g of cannellini beans, salt, and pepper.
Let cook together for about 15 minutes or until the sauce has reduced and thickened.

recipe_title: Pasta with Summer Vegetables and Spicy Peanut Sauce
original_instructions:
In a small saucepan combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, lime juice, garlic, cayenne and hot water. Whisk the sauce together over moderate heat until smooth and hot.
In a kettle of boiling salted water cook the pasta for 5 minutes. Add the sliced carrots to the cooking pasta, stir and cook for 1 minute. Add the broccoli, stir and cook for 30 seconds. Add the snow peas, stir and cook for another 30 seconds. Drain the pasta and vegetables in a colander.
Transfer the pasta and vegetables to a large bowl and pour the hot sauce over the mixture, tossing to combine. Sprinkle with scallions.
ingredients: 2 tablespoon rice vinegar or white wine vinegar
12 ounces pasta, i.e. rotelle, penne, farfalle
2 carrots, cut into thin slices diagonally
1/2 pound snow peas, trimmed and cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces
step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan, combine 0.19 cup smooth peanut butter, 0.75 tbsp soy sauce, 0.5 tbsp rice vinegar, 0.25 tbsp lime juice, 0.25 small garlic clove (minced), a pinch of cayenne, and 0.13 cup hot water.
Whisk the sauce together over moderate heat until smooth and hot.
In a kettle of boiling salted water cook 3 ounces of pasta for 5 minutes.
Add 0.5 carrot (cut into thin slices diagonally) to the cooking pasta, stir and cook for 1 minute.
Add 0.38 cup broccoli florets, stir and cook for 30 seconds.
Add 0.13 pound snow peas (trimmed and cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces), stir and cook for another 30 seconds.
Drain the pasta and vegetables in a colander.
Transfer the pasta and vegetables to a large bowl and pour the hot sauce over the mixture, tossing to combine.
Sprinkle with 1 scallion (thinly sliced).

recipe_title: Crisp Sea Bass with Braised Endive and Aged Balsamic Vinegar
original_instructions: Season the fish to taste with salt and pepper. Combine egg and cream to make an egg wash. Brush 1 side of the fillets with egg wash, then cover the egg wash side of fillets with bread crumb or cereal, and press down firmly. In a hot saute pan add 3 tablespoons oil. Place the fillets into the pan breaded side down. Cook for 2 minutes. Turn fillets over add the thyme and cook for approximately 2 minutes more, or until fillets are cooked, remove from pan. Meanwhile place 2 tablespoons oil into a hot pan, when the oil starts to smoke, add the endive. Toss the endive. Add the spice mix and the chives. Cook for 1 minute then remove from the heat. Place the endive in the center of 4 plates. Place the fish on top of the endive. Drizzle the chive oil around then the balsamic vinegar. Garnish with chives.;
ingredients: Sea salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
4 tablespoons panko bread crumbs (or your favorite cereal)
2 tablespoons chives (thinly sliced) plus extra for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Season 1 sea bass fillet with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Combine 0.25 egg and 0.75 tablespoon heavy cream to make an egg wash.
Brush 1 side of the fillet with the egg wash.
Cover the egg wash side of the fillet with 1 tablespoon panko bread crumbs and press down firmly.
In a hot saute pan, add 1.25 tablespoons vegetable oil.
Place the fillet into the pan, breaded side down.
Cook for 2 minutes, then turn the fillet over.
Add a sprig of thyme and cook for approximately 2 more minutes or until the fillet is cooked through.
Remove the fillet from the pan.
Meanwhile, place 0.5 tablespoon vegetable oil into a hot pan.
When the oil starts to smoke, add 1.5 pieces of Belgium endive.
Toss the endive and add a pinch of spice mix and 0.5 tablespoon chives.
Cook for 1 minute then remove from the heat.
Place the endive in the center of a plate.
Place the fish on top of the endive.
Drizzle chive oil around the plate, then add a dash of aged balsamic vinegar.
Garnish with a sprinkle of chives.

recipe_title: Bruschetta with Sundried Tomato and Mozzarella
original_instructions: Toast the bread slices on a baking sheet in the upper third of a preheated 500 degree oven for 4 minutes, or until they are golden. While the toasts are warm, brush both sides of the toasts with the oil and rub them with the garlic. In a bowl combine the tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste and top toasts with the mixture.;
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes in oil
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place 2 slices of Italian bread on a baking sheet.
Toast the bread slices in the upper third of the oven for 4 minutes or until they are golden.
While the toasts are warm, brush both sides of each toast with 0.5 tablespoons of olive oil.
Rub each toast with half of the garlic clove.

In a bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of chopped sun-dried tomatoes, 1 tablespoon of cubed mozzarella, 0.5 teaspoon of minced fresh basil leaves, 0.25 teaspoon of balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste.
Top each toast with the tomato and mozzarella mixture.

original_instructions:
Heat the oven to 325 degrees F/160 degrees C.
Cut slivers in the pork chops and slide in slices of garlic. Heat the pork fat or butter in a pan on high heat. Sprinkle the chops with salt and pepper and brown them, about 3 minutes per side.
Arrange half the potatoes and onions in a casserole. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and lay the chops on top. Scatter over the bacon and juniper berries. Cover with the remaining potatoes and onions. Sprinkle with salt and pepper again. Pour over the wine. Cut a piece of parchment to fit over the potatoes and pork chops and lay it in on top. Bake the dish for about 1 hour 30 minutes, pouring in the stock halfway through baking. Sprinkle with parsley to serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 pounds/750 g potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
1/2 cup/125 ml white wine, cider or beer
A handful of chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C).
Cut a small sliver in a pork chop and slide in a small slice of garlic.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of pork fat or butter in a pan on high heat.
Sprinkle the pork chop with salt and pepper.
Brown the chop, about 3 minutes per side.
Arrange half of 187.5 g of potatoes and some sliced onion in a casserole.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Lay the pork chop on top.
Scatter over one slice of bacon and a small portion of juniper berries.
Cover with the remaining potatoes and onions.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper again.
Pour over 31.25 ml of white wine.
Cut a piece of parchment to fit over the potatoes and pork chop and lay it on top.
Bake the dish for about 1 hour 30 minutes.
Pour in 31.25 ml of beef or chicken stock halfway through baking.
Sprinkle with some chopped fresh parsley to serve.

original_instructions: Peel ginger and cut into small pieces. Press about 1/2-inch piece of ginger in a garlic presser and squeeze ginger juice and small bits into a medium size bowl. Grate another 1/2-inch piece into same bowl. Finely chop the scallions and place in the same bowl. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Adjust by tasting and enjoy this fantastic Chinese dumpling dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon spicy Chinese chili red paste (optional)
step_by_step_instructions: Peel approximately 0.7 ounces of ginger.
Cut ginger into small pieces.
Press about 0.15-ounce piece of ginger in a garlic presser and squeeze ginger juice and small bits into a medium size bowl.
Grate another 0.15-ounce piece of ginger into the same bowl.
Finely chop 0.67 scallion (green onion) and place it in the same bowl.
Add 0.17 cup soy sauce to the bowl.
Add 0.67 tablespoon white vinegar to the bowl.
Add 0.5 teaspoon sugar to the bowl.
Add 0.67 tablespoon water to the bowl.
Add 0.33 teaspoon spicy Chinese chili red paste (optional) to the bowl.
Mix all ingredients well.
Taste and adjust if necessary.
processed_ingredients: 0.33 tsp spicy Chinese chili red paste

original_instructions: In a large heavy pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and peppers and cook until tender about 5-8 minutes. Stir in spices and toss to coat vegetables. Pour in stock and beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. In a blender, puree half of the soup until smooth and stir back into soup pot. Serve hot with garnishes.
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
step_by_step_instructions: In a large heavy pot, heat 0.67 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat.
Add approximately 0.25 cup chopped onion, 0.5 clove garlic (finely chopped), 0.17 cup chopped green bell pepper, and 0.17 cup chopped red bell pepper.
Cook the vegetables until tender, about 5-8 minutes.
Stir in 0.33 teaspoon cumin and 0.11 teaspoon cayenne pepper to coat the vegetables.
Pour in 1 cup low sodium chicken stock and approximately 0.67 can of black beans, drained and rinsed.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.
In a blender, puree half of the soup until smooth and stir it back into the soup pot.
Serve hot with garnishes like cheddar cheese, sour cream, and chopped red onion.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the ravioli and cook as the label directs. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, then drain the ravioli.
Combine the butter, cream and peas in a large skillet and bring to a simmer over medium heat; cook 1 minute. Add the ravioli, cheese, nutmeg and a splash of the reserved cooking water to the skillet and toss. Add more cooking water to thin the sauce, if needed. Season with salt and pepper. Divide among bowls and top with the parsley.
Photograph by Christopher Testani
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add approximately 4.5 ounces of mushroom ravioli to the pot and cook as the label directs.
Reserve about 2 tablespoons of the cooking water, then drain the ravioli.
Combine 1 tablespoon of butter, 1/8 cup of heavy cream, and 1/4 cup of thawed peas in a large skillet and bring to a simmer over medium heat; cook for 1 minute.
Add the cooked ravioli, 2 tablespoons of grated parmesan cheese, a pinch of nutmeg, and a splash of the reserved cooking water to the skillet and toss.
Add more cooking water to thin the sauce, if needed.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide the ravioli among bowls and top with 1 teaspoon of chopped parsley.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: 2 wire racks 2 rimmed baking sheets
Adjust 2 oven racks to the top and bottom thirds of the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F. Put the wire racks in the baking sheets and coat each generously with cooking spray.
Combine the flour and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a large re-sealable plastic bag. Combine the eggs and 3/4 teaspoon salt in another large plastic bag; combine the breadcrumbs, Parmesan and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a third large plastic bag.
Add about a half of the zucchini sticks to the bag with the flour and use a combination of your hands and shaking the bag to coat the zucchini. Remove the zucchini and shake off any excess flour. Transfer to the egg wash and repeat until coated. (It's less messy if you use only one hand for the dry ingredients and the other for the wet.) Let any excess egg drip off before transferring to the breadcrumb mixture; repeat until fully coated (you'll still see some green and white of the zucchini peeking through the breading). Transfer to the prepared baking sheets and coat the breaded zucchini generously with cooking spray (there's no need to turn them). Repeat with the remaining zucchini.
Bake, rotating the baking sheets from top to bottom about halfway through, until golden brown and tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with a little salt and serve warm with your favorite dipping sauces.
ingredients: 1 pound zucchini (2 to 3 small-to-medium zucchini), cut into 3-inch-by-1/4-inch sticks
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat your oven to 425 degrees F and adjust the racks to the top and bottom thirds.
Place a wire rack in a rimmed baking sheet and coat it generously with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large re-sealable plastic bag, combine 1 tablespoon of flour with a pinch of salt.
In another large plastic bag, beat 1/2 of a large egg with a pinch of salt.
In a third large plastic bag, mix 1/2 cup of panko breadcrumbs with 1 tablespoon of finely grated Parmesan and a pinch of salt.
Add about 1/3 of the zucchini sticks to the bag with the flour and shake to coat. Remove and shake off excess flour.
Transfer the flour-coated zucchini to the egg wash, ensuring they are fully coated, and let any excess egg drip off.
Move the zucchini to the breadcrumb mixture and shake until fully coated.
Place the breaded zucchini on the prepared baking sheet and spray them generously with cooking spray.
Repeat the coating process with the remaining zucchini.
Bake the zucchini fries in the oven, rotating the baking sheet halfway through, for 25 to 30 minutes until they are golden brown and tender.
Sprinkle with a little salt before serving warm with your favorite dipping sauce.

original_instructions:
Make Filling: Preheat the oven to 350° F with the rack in the middle. Butter a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Bring 1-inch salted water to a boil in a large saucepan. Meanwhile, wash lamb's-quarters in a large bowl of cold water and drain well. Trim any coarse, woody stems at bottom (don't go crazy with trimming; young lamb's-quarter stems cook up tender and delicious). Add lamb's-quarters to pot and cook over medium heat, covered, until leaves are wilted and stems are tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain the greens in a large sieve or colander and rinse well under cold running water. Drain again, pressing out excess liquid with the back of a large spoon. Coarsely chop greens and transfer to a bowl. Dry saucepan and reserve. Cook scallions in olive oil with 1/4 teaspoon salt in reserved saucepan over medium heat, stirring, until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Combine scallion mixture with greens in bowl. Reserve saucepan again. Melt butter in reserved saucepan over medium-low heat and stir in flour. Cook, stirring, 2 minutes, then whisk in milk and bring to a boil, whisking. Reduce heat and simmer sauce, whisking, 2 minutes (it will be thick). Remove from heat and whisk in nutmeg, zest, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix sauce into greens mixture. If the mixture is too thick, thin with a little additional milk; season with salt and pepper. Spread out mixture in baking dish.
Preheat the oven to 350° F with the rack in the middle. Butter a 2-quart shallow baking dish.
Bring 1-inch salted water to a boil in a large saucepan. Meanwhile, wash lamb's-quarters in a large bowl of cold water and drain well. Trim any coarse, woody stems at bottom (don't go crazy with trimming; young lamb's-quarter stems cook up tender and delicious).
Add lamb's-quarters to pot and cook over medium heat, covered, until leaves are wilted and stems are tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain the greens in a large sieve or colander and rinse well under cold running water. Drain again, pressing out excess liquid with the back of a large spoon. Coarsely chop greens and transfer to a bowl. Dry saucepan and reserve.
Cook scallions in olive oil with 1/4 teaspoon salt in reserved saucepan over medium heat, stirring, until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Combine scallion mixture with greens in bowl. Reserve saucepan again.
Melt butter in reserved saucepan over medium-low heat and stir in flour. Cook, stirring, 2 minutes, then whisk in milk and bring to a boil, whisking. Reduce heat and simmer sauce, whisking, 2 minutes (it will be thick). Remove from heat and whisk in nutmeg, zest, and salt and pepper to taste.
Mix sauce into greens mixture. If the mixture is too thick, thin with a little additional milk; season with salt and pepper. Spread out mixture in baking dish.
